shortlist.name: Ask Brewster (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last three starts, suggesting improvement and peak fitness. Trainer/jockey combination is reliable, and odds indicate market respect. No major negatives in recent form.

shortlist.name: Ile De Jersey (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent and in-form, winning two of last four and placed in all recent runs. Top connections with Henderson/de Boinville. Recent win shows readiness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Neon Moon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this grade, regularly in the frame. Pipe stable in good form and runner is proven at the trip. Odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: Gibbs Island
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile last season with back-to-back wins before a pulled-up and a below-par effort; returns fresh for a yard adept at readying one after a break. Market support is strong and connections are reliable at this venue.

shortlist.name: Hope Rising (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with multiple wins and runner-up finishes in recent starts, showing adaptability and resilience. Remains on an upward curve and is proven at this level; strong connections and reliable recent form.

shortlist.name: Aviemore
shortlist.rationale: Progressed well last campaign with two wins before a pulled-up effort, which can be forgiven given prior consistency. Yard is in good form and the horse has shown ability to win fresh.

shortlist.name: Theatre Of Flight
shortlist.odds: 9/4 SBK, 5.0 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form, having won last time out after a progressive profile. Reliable connections and strong market position indicate confidence. No signs of regression in recent runs, and the form figures suggest the horse is still improving or at least holding form at a high level.

shortlist.name: Paddy De Pole (Ire)
shortlist.odds: 4/1 SBK, 6.2 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win, trained by a top yard. The form shows regular placings and a bounce-back to winning ways last time, indicating the horse is in good heart. Connections are notable, and odds reflect genuine respect from the market.

shortlist.name: Marlacoo (Ire)
shortlist.odds: 6/1 SBK, 6.4 exchange (third in market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with multiple wins and placings in recent starts. Returned with a respectable third, suggesting fitness and form remain intact. Trainer and jockey are both capable, and the horse's profile fits a reliable, in-form contender.

shortlist.name: Ballydangan (Ire)
shortlist.odds: 11/4 SBK, 4.8 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two wins from last three starts, including a recent victory. Consistent profile, proven stamina, and holding form well. Market support confirms strong chance.

shortlist.name: Fox's Fancy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and consistent, placed in all recent starts. Returns from a break but represents top connections and has scope for improvement.

shortlist.name: Sean Og (Ire)
shortlist.odds: 11/2 SBK, 6 exchange (short enough, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with recent seconds and thirds at this level. Top jockey booked. Reliable profile, though may find one too good for win purposes.

shortlist.name: Damysus
shortlist.odds: 6/4 SBK, 2.88 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Proven winning form, returns to winning ways last time out, top connections, and current odds reflect strong confidence. No signs of decline and profile fits a peak performer at this level.

shortlist.name: Gladius (Ire)
shortlist.odds: 10/3 SBK, 4.8 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, progressive profile with multiple wins and a recent fourth in a likely stronger contest. Top jockey/trainer combo and odds indicate respect from the market.

shortlist.name: First Conquest
shortlist.odds: 15/4 SBK, 5.3 exchange (well found in market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Solid form this season with two wins and recent placed efforts. Trained by a leading yard and partnered by a top jockey. Consistent at this level and odds suggest competitiveness.

shortlist.name: Endorsement (Ire)
shortlist.odds: 9/4 SBK, 3.6 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a second from two starts, representing the top-class O'Brien yard. Market leader with solid form and proven connections. No sign of regression and expected to be at peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Look To The Stars (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes in off back-to-back wins and has never finished outside the top two in four starts. Trained by Appleby and ridden by Buick, both highly reliable at this venue. Consistent, progressive, and well found in the market.

shortlist.name: Pierre Bonnard (Ire)
shortlist.odds: 15/4 SBK, 5.5 exchange (third choice, respected in market)
shortlist.rationale: Improved markedly to win last time out for the O'Brien team. Still unexposed and open to further progress. Soumillon is a top international jockey, and the market respects his chances.

shortlist.name: Hankelow (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a win and a second, indicating consistency and progression. Trainer is in good form and the odds suggest strong market confidence. No signs of regression and connections are reliable.

shortlist.name: Al Zanati
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut winner for a top yard. Buick and Appleby are a proven combination at Newmarket, and the odds reflect strong support. Form is unexposed but highly promising.

shortlist.name: Straight Up (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut for elite connections. Soumillon is a top international jockey and O'Brien excels with juveniles at this meeting. Market respects the horse and form is progressive.

shortlist.name: Distant Storm
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins from last three starts, representing top connections (Appleby/Buick) who excel at this venue. Recent win suggests peak form and odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Gstaad
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with two wins and two seconds in last four, trained by O'Brien and ridden by Soumillon. Proven at this level and holding form, with odds indicating strong support.

shortlist.name: Zavateri (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Unbeaten in four starts, showing progressive form. Steps up in class but market respect and perfect record warrant inclusion among strongest contenders.

shortlist.name: Celandine
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent improvement, strong odds value.

shortlist.name: Dubai Treasure (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong connections and recent form suggest potential for a win.

shortlist.name: Circe (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency, though recent performance was less impressive.

shortlist.name: Shetakesthegold
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with multiple recent placings and a win in the last eight starts. Proven at the track and trip, and represents a top yard. Reliable form and no sign of regression.

shortlist.name: Oh So Perfect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with scope for improvement; last run was a solid effort in a stronger race. Trainer Charlie Fellowes is in good form and the market support is notable. No need for major improvement to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Sharpness
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a strong third and fourth in recent starts, suggesting readiness to win soon. Trainer is adept with this type and the odds offer value relative to form. No major improvement required.

shortlist.name: Woody Y Fernandez
shortlist.odds: 4/1 SBK, 5.0 exchange (solid market position, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placings, indicating reliability and fitness. Connections are competent at this level. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Thanh Nam
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a close fourth last time, suggesting readiness to peak. Market confidence is notable and connections are respected at this level.

shortlist.name: Miss Ayala (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (last time out), showing clear improvement and ability to win in this grade. Market support is positive and form is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Outer Edge
shortlist.odds: Exchange 4.1, SBK 13/2; solid market support, clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner this season and holding form well; latest efforts competitive in similar company. Market support is strong and connections are reliable at this level. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Henery Hawk
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with two wins in last six starts, including recent success. Form is solid for this grade and odds reflect genuine chance. Connections have placed the horse well.

shortlist.name: Basholo (Ire)
shortlist.odds: Exchange 5.2, SBK 10/3; well found in market.
shortlist.rationale: Has placed twice this season and generally runs well at this level. Odds are short, indicating stable confidence. Recent form is competitive and no major improvement is required to feature.

shortlist.name: He's Waliim
shortlist.rationale: Proven winning form, recent runner-up and win indicate peak condition. Top connections with Tudhope and Tate. Odds reflect strong market support and form reliability.

shortlist.name: Laazm (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with win and second in only two starts, suggesting untapped potential. Balding/McDonald combination is respected. Odds offer reasonable value for a lightly raced improver.

shortlist.name: Boiling Over (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win two starts back and placed efforts. Trainer Burke is in form and runner is well supported in the market. Reliable for exotics and place prospects.

shortlist.name: Joulany (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up on debut, representing a top yard with a strong record in similar races. The market leader, suggesting confidence from connections and punters. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Morshdi
shortlist.rationale: Solid debut second for a leading trainer/jockey combination. Well-supported in the market and likely to progress, with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Valenday
shortlist.rationale: Another debut runner-up, showing immediate promise. Trainer has a good record with juveniles at York. Market support suggests a competitive chance.

shortlist.name: Berkshire Sundance (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile last season with two wins before a break; returns for a top yard with a capable jockey. Market support is notable, and the form suggests ability to win at this level if fit. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Queen Roslyn
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins before latest run. Trainer is adept at placing horses at York, and the recent form is strong for this grade. Odds reflect genuine chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Molten Sea
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win and multiple placings this season. Trained by William Haggas, a top yard, and partnered with Tom Marquand, both strong connections. Current odds offer value for a horse with proven form at this level and no major negatives in the profile.

shortlist.name: Relieved Of Duties (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with a top jockey and trainer combination. Recent form includes a fall and a fifth, but prior runs show reliability and ability to compete in this grade. Market support is strong, indicating stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Come On The Lads (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent recent form, regularly placing and winning at this level. Trainer and jockey are both in good form. Odds reflect realistic winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Koori Star (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is solid, with multiple placings and a close fourth last time out. Connections are capable, and exchange market support is notable. Should be competitive if repeating recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Paul's Dream (Ire)
shortlist.odds: 7/2 SBK, 5.0 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes and two wins in last six starts, indicating peak fitness and reliability. Connections are respected and the horse is holding form well, with no signs of decline. Odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Tequila Talkin' (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and third in last three completed starts, with a fall and a pulled-up run that can be forgiven in context of jumps racing. Trainer is capable and the market support is notable. Horse has shown ability to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Desert Haven
shortlist.odds: 15/2 SBK, 3.4 exchange (not a longshot, exchange market favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show three placings from last four starts, including a close second and third, suggesting the horse is in good shape and ready to win. The exchange market has made this runner favourite, indicating strong professional support.

shortlist.name: Diego El Queso (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes, indicating readiness to win. Top jockey and trainer combination. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and form reliability.

shortlist.name: Maestro Bernstein (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents a leading stable with a strong record in maidens. Only one run (8th) but likely to improve significantly on debut, as is typical for the yard. Market support suggests ability.

shortlist.name: Retrograde (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: From a top yard and shaped with promise on debut (5th). Expected to progress with experience. Market position indicates respect and potential for improvement.

shortlist.name: Amiata (Ire)
shortlist.odds: Exchange 3.9, SBK 7/1 (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win signals peak form and readiness. Connections are strong: Lyons/Keane are proven at Naas. Odds indicate genuine market respect, and the horse is not overexposed.

shortlist.name: First Approach (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Aidan O'Brien-trained runner with competitive form in higher grade races. Recent placings suggest consistency and class edge. Odds are fair for a horse with top connections and proven ability.

shortlist.name: Morehampton (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a win and placed efforts in recent starts. Murtagh/Coen combination is reliable, and the horse is well-fancied in the market, suggesting confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: Queen Of Mougins (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner this season and generally consistent in the frame. Slight dip last time but overall profile is progressive for this grade. Jockey/trainer combination is respected.

shortlist.name: Powerful Nation (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with a win and two places in last six starts; recent form slightly dipped but remains competitive. Connections are reliable and odds indicate strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Fandom
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced, progressive profile with two wins from last four starts. Fifth on seasonal return can be forgiven; likely to improve for top connections. Market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Arklow Lad (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Rapid recent improvement, culminating in a win last time out. Lightly raced and open to further progress. Top jockey booked and market position suggests stable confidence.
shortlist.confidence: High – progressive profile, recent win, and strong connections.

shortlist.name: Nezeeh (Ire)
shortlist.odds: 11/2 (sbk), 3.7 (exchange) – solid market support, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings, including a win two starts ago. Proven fitness and reliability, with connections in good order. Odds indicate strong market confidence and value for a runner with this profile.
shortlist.confidence: High – best recent form in the field, strong win record, and market support.

shortlist.name: Likedbymike (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level, with a strong second last time out. Top jockey booking is a positive. Odds indicate market confidence for a horse with proven ability in similar races.
shortlist.confidence: Medium – reliable profile, strong connections, and competitive odds.

shortlist.name: Treasure Rose (Ire)
shortlist.odds: Strong market support (exchange 2.46, sbk 3/1); clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, suggesting reliability and fitness. Connections are respected, and odds indicate strong market confidence. No sign of regression in form cycle, and profile fits a likely winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Therewillbeglory (Ire)
shortlist.odds: Well-backed (exchange 3.5, sbk 2/1); second choice in market.
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with three consecutive runner-up finishes, indicating readiness to win. Form is peaking and horse is holding condition well. Market position and recent efforts suggest a breakthrough is imminent.

shortlist.name: Tea Rose (Ire)
shortlist.odds: Solid support (exchange 3.6, sbk 5/1); third in market.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile for top connections. Two fourths this season after a break suggest improvement is likely, and O'Brien-trained runners often peak with racing. Market respect and potential for further progress make this a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Rowdy Yeats (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent wins and places, including a last-time-out victory. Top jockey booking and trainer in form. Profile suggests reliability and peak fitness, with odds reflecting strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Bishopton (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in top form after back-to-back wins, indicating improvement and readiness. Connections have placed the horse well and the odds suggest genuine market respect. Recent form is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Tina's Indian (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third signals return to form after a win last season. Consistent at this level and market support is notable. Jockey/trainer combination is reliable and the horse is fit and competitive.

note: Filtered to top 3 profitable picks per race
